Product Title: AIKIMUSE Face Oil Primer(1 Count)，Makeup Primer,24k Rose Gold Elixir，Skin Beauty Oil Essential，For Use Under Makeup or as a Face Oil Skin Moisturizing Product
Review Date: 2018/11/28
Store: AIKIMUSE
Average Rating: 4.0
Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '4.7 x 4.7 x 3.2 inches; 2.88 Ounces', 'UPC': '756289563933'}
Review Text: Its great to make your skin looks hidrataded. I buy it cause my lips, but it works great in skin too. But if you use it before makeup, your skin going to look oily, so I recomend to use a opaque powder or just use it at night before sleep. If your skin is oily maybe is not good for you neither cause this product made my skin too oily after use it and my skin is dry.  Plus, I used it to repare my old mascara, I had to use a little more product that I expected, but it works.
Review Title: I recomend to use it if you have a dry skin only.
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: This works good, it has rubber parts to keep it in the hair so be aware because can take off hair easily I broke a few trying to figured out how to apply and taking it off. I dont recommend it for thin and fragile hair. It comes woth enough tubes for a full head so I think worth the cost

raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
This individual demonstrates a clear preference for beauty and personal care products, particularly those related to makeup and temporary body art. Consistently high ratings reflect satisfaction with ease of use, durability, and versatility. There is a notable inclination towards products that enhance appearance, such as skin-moisturizing oils and hair styling tools, indicating a desire for practical and aesthetic improvements.

Recurring themes in their purchases include temporary applications, such as tattoos and hair curling without heat, suggesting a preference for non-permanent solutions. Quality returns as a priority, as the customer shares experiences with product longevity and effectiveness, while also voicing caution for sensitive hair types.

Price sensitivity appears moderate, with some emphasis on value-for-money, especially in products requiring multiple uses or offering a full kit. Products encompassing skin hydration and hair care are favored, although there is critical awareness of specific needs, as seen in product tool compatibility with hair types. Overall, the buyer leans towards high-functionality cosmetics that provide reliable results, utilized for both personal and artistic expression.
